rules: Rule1: Provided that an employee works on a project, then if it is not the case that the employee plays a game, the employee is assigned a desk.
Rule2: If an employee manages a team, then a manager approves a budget.
Rule3: Whenever an employee attends a meeting, it follows that the employee works on a project.
Rule4: Under the condition that an employee completes a report, the employee attends a meeting.
Rule5: If an employee submits a proposal, then the employee completes a report.

Rule6: If it is not true that the negation of (the negation of (winning a promotion implies not managing a team) leading to a transfer to a department) implies a resignation from the company, then the employee is fired from a position.

Rule7: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of (the negation of (winning a promotion implies not managing a team) leading to a transfer to a department) implies a resignation from the company, it is not true that the employee is fired from a position.
Rule8: If it is not the case that an employee works on a project, then the employee manages a team.
facts: Fact1: An employee submits a proposal.
Fact2: An employee wins a promotion.
Fact3: It is not the case that an employee is assigned a desk.
Fact4: An employee does not resign from the company.
Fact5: It is not true that a manager approves a budget.
Fact6: An employee does not transfer to a department.
